issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
iOS: Accessibility : Accessibility does not work for option dialog control.
This is not a regression. Issue occur since 3.0.0.GA

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run the app Accessibility Acceptance Access_1105 under Accessibility module.
2. Touch the second button (with LVH defined in sequence).

Expected:
LVH values should be spoken.

Actual:
The option dialog with accessibility properties defined in LVH order is opened.The device reads aloud LVH - (Option dialog2 label , Option dialog2 value , Option dialog2 hint).
fields.summary: iOS: Accessibility: Accessibility does not work for option dialog control. LVH values are not spoken.
fields.environment:
Device : iPad 4, iOS version: 6
SDK: 3.1.2.v20130725180746
CLI version : 3.1.1
OS : MAC OSX 10.8.4
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.1.2.201307261628
XCode : 4.6.3

comments.body: Closing ticket due to the time passed and lack of progress over the past few years. Any problems, please open a new ticket.
